newsitem.title: USA: El Paso Tennessee Q4 net $34 mln with charge.
newsitem.headline: El Paso Tennessee Q4 net $34 mln with charge.

text.p: El Paso Tennessee Pipeline Co on Friday said net income for the fourth quarter of 1996 adjusted for an extraordinary charge was $34 million, compared with adjusted net income of $45 million for the year-earlier perriod.
The company, formerly Tenneco Inc, said in a statement it recorded an after-tax extraordinary charge of $234 million for a debt realignment before its merger with El Paso Energy Corp.

It said its reported net loss for the fourth quarter of 1996 including the fourth-quarter extraordinary charge was $200 million. Reported net income for the same period the previous year was $105 million, which included an after-tax gain of $60 million on the sale of its Kern River interest, it added.

The company said its adjusted net loss for 1996 totalled $105 million after the fourth-quarter extraordinary charge, compared with a profit of $157 million the year earlier, which included the gain from the sale of the interest.
El Paso officials were not available to elaborate.
